SIHR 0.1.0
  • Reference

Constructs the projection direction with fixed tuning parameter in high dimensional regression

Direction_fixedtuning.Rd

Constructs the projection direction with fixed tuning parameter in high dimensional regression

Direction_fixedtuning(
  X,
  loading,
  mu = NULL,
  model = "linear",
  weight = NULL,
  deriv.vec = NULL
)

Arguments

X

Design matrix, of dimension \(n\) x \(p\)
loading

Loading, of length \(p\)
mu

The dual tuning parameter used in the construction of the projection direction
model

The high dimensional regression model, either linear or logistic
weight

The weight vector of length \(n\), used in correcting the plug-in estimator ; to be supplied if model="logistic" (default=NULL)
deriv.vec

The first derivative vector of the logit function at \(X\widehat{\beta}\) ; to be supplied if model="logistic"

Value

proj

The projection direction

Examples

n = 100
p = 400
X = matrix(sample(-2:2,n*p,replace = TRUE),nrow = n,ncol = p)
resol = 1.5
step = 3
Direction_fixedtuning(X,loading=c(1,rep(0,(p-1))),mu=sqrt(2.01*log(p)/n)*resol^{-(step-1)})
#> [1] "fixed mu"
#> [1] 0.1542347
